description.en:
Choose at least one 30 credit (or larger) optional study module, or two 15 credit (or larger) optional study modules.

You can choose optional study modules from the Faculty of Arts or other faculties (see Optional Studies in Instructions for Students). You can also use study modules completed at another university or studies completed during a student exchange as optional study modules.

You can see the structure of any optional study module offered by the University of Helsinki by searching for it with its code and placing it in the degree structure.

Note that some optional study modules are unrestricted (you can begin studying them without a study right), while others are restricted (you can only study them if you have received a study right) (see Instruction for Students).

If you wish to become a subject teacher, you will need to complete 60 credits of studies in your second teaching subject as optional studies during your BA degree (see Studies in the Teaching Subject for Subject Teachers in instructions for Students).
description.fi:
Valitse valinnaisia opintokokonaisuuksia v채hint채채n yksi 30 opintopisteen (tai laajempi) kokonaisuus tai kaksi 15 opintopisteen (tai laajempaa) kokonaisuutta.

Voit valita valinnaisia opintokokonaisuuksia humanistisesta tiedekunnasta tai muista tiedekunnista (ks. valinnaisten opintojen tarjonta Opiskelijan ohjeissa). Voit k채ytt채채 my철s toisessa yliopistossa tai opiskelijavaihdossa suorittamiasi opintokokonaisuuksia valinnaisiin opintokokonaisuuksiin.

N채et Helsingin yliopistossa suoritettavan valinnaisen opintokokonaisuuden rakenteen, kun haet kokonaisuutta tunnisteella ja sijoitat sen tutkintorakenteeseen.

Huomaathan, ett채 toiset valinnaisten opintojen kokonaisuudet ovat vapaita (voit aloittaa niiden opiskelun ilman opinto-oikeutta), kun taas toiset ovat rajoituksenalaisia (niiden opiskeluun vaaditaan opinto-oikeus) (ks. Opiskelijan ohjeet).

description.en:
You can complete requirements in English with alternative ways:
1) by taking a course for Faculty of Arts students KK-ENHUM (4 sp) or KK-ENHUM1 (2 cr) + KK-ENHUM2 (2 cr).NB! If you are missing 2 credits of English from your degree, you can also complete the course KK-ENKAIKKI1/2 (2 cr).

2) by taking a KK-ENHUM ALMS-group (4 cr) based on autonomous learning . More information about ALMS: https://blogs.helsinki.fi/alms-helsinki/

3) by taking a course open for all faculty students KK-ENKAIKKI (4 sp)
4) by taking a course KK-ENERI (4 sp) which is a course especially for those students who has learning difficulties or anxieties with English studies.
5) by taking an exemption test KK-ENHUM (4 sp).

The foreign language (4 cr) included in degree can be completed with either a course or an exemption test (starting skill level in English: CEFR B2, in other languages: CEFR B1).

description.en:
According to the Government Decree on University Degrees (6 짠) all degrees include a certain amount of compulsory communication and language studies. These studies are completed as part of a first-cycle, or bachelor쨈s degree and their minimum scope is 10 cr.


Communication and language studies are completed as follows:

  • Native language (Finnish/Swedish, language of secondary education is Finnish/Swedish) 3 cr
  • Second national language (Swedish/Finnish, language of secondary education is Finnish/Swedish) 3 cr
  • Foreign language 4 cr (starting skill level in English: CEFR B2, in other languages: CEFR B1)
A student can get an exemption from the communication and language skills e.g. partially (exemption from starting skill level) according to the Guidelines for degrees and studies at the University of Helsinki. More information in Instructions for Students: https://studies.helsinki.fi/instructions/article/language-and-communication-studies-included-bachelors-degree

description.en:
Choose at least one 30 credit (or larger) optional study module, or two 15 credit (or larger) optional study modules.

You can choose optional study modules from the Faculty of Arts or other faculties (see Optional Studies in Instructions for Students). You can also use study modules completed at another university or studies completed during a student exchange as optional study modules.

You can see the structure of any optional study module offered by the University of Helsinki by searching for it with its code and placing it in the degree structure.

Note that some optional study modules are unrestricted (you can begin studying them without a study right), while others are restricted (you can only study them if you have received a study right) (see Instruction for Students).

If you wish to become a subject teacher, you will need to complete 60 credits of studies in your second teaching subject as optional studies during your BA degree (see Studies in the Teaching Subject for Subject Teachers in instructions for Students).
description.fi:
Valitse valinnaisia opintokokonaisuuksia v채hint채채n yksi 30 opintopisteen (tai laajempi) kokonaisuus tai kaksi 15 opintopisteen (tai laajempaa) kokonaisuutta.

Voit valita valinnaisia opintokokonaisuuksia humanistisesta tiedekunnasta tai muista tiedekunnista (ks. valinnaisten opintojen tarjonta Opiskelijan ohjeissa). Voit k채ytt채채 my철s toisessa yliopistossa tai opiskelijavaihdossa suorittamiasi opintokokonaisuuksia valinnaisiin opintokokonaisuuksiin.

N채et Helsingin yliopistossa suoritettavan valinnaisen opintokokonaisuuden rakenteen, kun haet kokonaisuutta tunnisteella ja sijoitat sen tutkintorakenteeseen.

Huomaathan, ett채 toiset valinnaisten opintojen kokonaisuudet ovat vapaita (voit aloittaa niiden opiskelun ilman opinto-oikeutta), kun taas toiset ovat rajoituksenalaisia (niiden opiskeluun vaaditaan opinto-oikeus) (ks. Opiskelijan ohjeet).

Jos haluat aineenopettajaksi, toisen opetettavan aineen opinnot 60 op suoritetaan valinnaisina opintoina kandivaiheessa (ks. opetettavat aineet Opiskelijan ohjeissa).

You can complete requirements in English with alternative ways:
1) by taking a course for Faculty of Arts students KK-ENHUM (4 sp) or KK-ENHUM1 (2 cr) + KK-ENHUM2 (2 cr).NB! If you are missing 2 credits of English from your degree, you can also complete the course KK-ENKAIKKI1/2 (2 cr).

2) by taking a KK-ENHUM ALMS-group (4 cr) based on autonomous learning . More information about ALMS: https://blogs.helsinki.fi/alms-helsinki/

3) by taking a course open for all faculty students KK-ENKAIKKI (4 sp)
4) by taking a course KK-ENERI (4 sp) which is a course especially for those students who has learning difficulties or anxieties with English studies.
5) by taking an exemption test KK-ENHUM (4 sp).

description.en:
According to the Government Decree on University Degrees (6 짠) all degrees include a certain amount of compulsory communication and language studies. These studies are completed as part of a first-cycle, or bachelor쨈s degree and their minimum scope is 10 cr.


Communication and language studies are completed as follows:

  • Native language (Finnish/Swedish, language of secondary education is Finnish/Swedish) 3 cr
  • Second national language (Swedish/Finnish, language of secondary education is Finnish/Swedish) 3 cr
  • Foreign language 4 cr (starting skill level in English: CEFR B2, in other languages: CEFR B1)
A student can get an exemption from the communication and language skills e.g. partially (exemption from starting skill level) according to the Guidelines for degrees and studies at the University of Helsinki. More information in Instructions for Students: https://studies.helsinki.fi/instructions/article/language-and-communication-studies-included-bachelors-degree
